ResetAccountDescription1.message: Resetting your account will clear all your pending transactions. This can help you solve the problem that in some cases the state of the transaction in Rabby does not match the state on-chain.

ResetAccountDescription2.message: This will not change the balances in your accounts or require you to re-enter your Secret Recovery Phrase. All your assets and accounts information will remain secure.

SelectHDPath.message: If you don't see the addresses you expect, try switching the HD path:

SwapCheckEtherscanToken.message: Different tokens may use the same name and symbol. Check {{scan}} to verify this is the token you're looking for.

SlippageTip.message: If the price changes between the time your order is placed and confirmed, it's called "slippage". Your order will be canceled if the price change more than your slippage setting.

LowSlippageToleranceWarn.message: Transaction may fail due to low slippage tolerance.

HighSlippageToleranceWarn.message: High slippage tolerance may result in uneconomic trading.

HighSlippageToleranceError.message: High slippage tolerance may result in large losses. Please set your max slippage below 15%.

FailGetQuote.message: Can't get a quote due to bad internet status. Please try again later.

NoAvailableQuote.message: Sorry, no available quotes were found.

ChangeSlippage.message: Do you want to go back and change the max slippage to get new quotes?

QuoteDesc.message: Rabby searches multiple liquidity sources (exchanges, aggregators, and professional market makers) to find the best rates and lowest network fees. A fee of {{feeRatio}}% has been deducted from all quotes.

ReceivingAmountDesc.message: This is an estimate. The exact amount received depends on slippage. Each quote has deducted {{feeRatio}}% as a service fee for Rabby.

EstGasFeeDesc.message: This is an estimated gas cost for your transaction. The actual gas cost may change based on network conditions.

MaxSlippageDesc.message: If the price changes between the time your order is placed and confirmed, it's called "slippage". Your order will be canceled if the price change more than your slippage setting.

LiquiditySourceDesc.message: Available liquidity sources are dexes, aggregators, and professional market makers.

The__token__on__this__chain__is__not__su.message: The token on this chain is not supported for swap

The__minimum__amount__received__under__t.message: The minimum amount received under the current slippage tolerance

gasTopUpDescribe.message: Top up gas by sending us available tokens on another chain. Instant transfer as soon as your payment is confirmed, without waiting for it to be irreversible.

service__fee__tip.message: By providing the service for Gas Top Up, Rabby has to bear the loss of token fluctuation and the gas fee for the top up. Therefore a 20% service fee is charged.

Gas__Top__Up__Insufficient__Balance.message: There is not enough balance in Rabby's contract address for the current chain. Please try again later.

Gas__Top__Up__hight__gas__fees.message: This top up amount is too small because the target network requires high gas fees.

signTx.gasLimitNotEnough: Gas limit is less than 21000. Transaction can't be submitted
signTx.gasLimitLessThanExpect: Gas limit is low. There is 1% chance that the transaction may fail.
signTx.gasLimitLessThanGasUsed: Gas limit is too low. There is 95% chance that the transaction may fail.
signTx.nativeTokenNotEngouthForGas: You do not have enough gas in your wallet
signTx.nonceLowerThanExpect: Nonce is too low, the minimum should be {{0}}
signTx.canOnlyUseImportedAddress: You can only use imported addresses to sign
signTx.multiSigChainNotMatch: Multi-signature addresses are not on this chain and cannot initiate transactions
signTx.safeAddressNotSupportChain: Current safe address is not supported on {{0}} chain
signTx.manuallySetGasLimitAlert: You have manually set the Gas limit to
signTx.gasNotRequireForSafeTransaction: Gas fee is not required for Safe transactions
signTx.eip1559Desc1: On chains that support EIP-1559, the Priority Fee is the tip for miners to process your transaction. You can save your final gas cost by lowering the Priority Fee, which may cost more time for the transaction to be processed.
signTx.eip1559Desc2: Here in Rabby, Priority Fee (Tip) = Max Fee - Base Fee. After you set up the Max Priority Fee, the Base Fee will be deducted from it and the rest will be tipped to miners.
signTx.hardwareSupport1559Alert: Make sure your hardware wallet firmware has been upgraded to the version that supports EIP 1559
signTx.gasLimitMinValueAlert: Gas limit should be more than 21000

whatIsASeedPhrase.question: What is a Seed Phrase?
whatIsASeedPhrase.answer: A 12, 18, or 24-word phrase used to control your assets.

isItSafeToImportItInRabby.question: Is it safe to import it in Rabby?
isItSafeToImportItInRabby.answer: Yes, it will be stored locally on your browser and only accessible to you.

seedPhrase.importQuestion1: If I lose my seed phrase, my assets will be lost forever.
seedPhrase.importQuestion2: If I share my seed phrase with others, my assets will be stolen.
seedPhrase.importQuestion3: The seed phrase is only stored on my computer, and Rabby has no access to it.
seedPhrase.importQuestion4: If I uninstall Rabby without backing up the seed phrase, Rabby cannot retrieve it for me.
seedPhrase.riskTips: Before you start, please read and keep the following security tips in mind.
seedPhrase.backupTips: Make sure no one else is watching your screen when you back up the seed phrase
seedPhrase.fillInTheBackupSeedPhraseInOrder: Fill in the backup seed phrase in order

metamask.importSeedPhraseTips: It will only be stored locally on the browser. Rabby will never have access to your private information.

whatIsAPrivateKey.question: What is a private key?
whatIsAPrivateKey.answer: A string of letters and numbers used to control your assets.

isItSafeToImportItInRabby.question: Is it safe to import it in Rabby?
isItSafeToImportItInRabby.answer: Yes, it will be stored locally on your browser and only accessible to you.

isItPossibleToImportKeystore.question: Is it possible to import KeyStore?
isItPossibleToImportKeystore.answer: Yes, you can <1> import KeyStore </1> here.
